description: Soho is a unique neighbourhood of creativity and diversity. Join us at the former Warner Brothers De Lane Lea studio at 75 Dean Street, home of the Museum of Soho.  Explore an exhibition of Soho's 300 year history.   See short films and talks on Soho in our 80 seater screening room.

factsheet.heading: Timelines: 300 years of Soho.
paragraphs:
Soho is an urban village, shaped and redrawn through time and the extraordinary array of creative and talented people who have made it their home or work canvass.
 
Join us at the former Warner Brother Sound Studio at 75 Dean Street, home to the Museum of Soho.
 
Explore our exhibition Timelines: 300 The People, The Places, The Pulse.
Speak to one of our volunteers for suggestions as you continue to explore our extraordinary neighbourhood.

factsheet.heading: Sharing Stories:  Changing Hearts and Minds
paragraphs: Take a seat in the 80 seater air conditioned screening room.  Booking advised but not essential.
12.15- 1.pm Welcome to Sharing Stories/Timelines followed by "Voices of Soho".
A documentary that captures interviews with those who have lived and worked in the area over the years, highlighting its distinctive character and its role as the vibrant heart of London.
Updates from a number of wellbeing projects finishing with poetry from local poet Don Pepper.
Bohemia Revisited:  A talk by local cultural explorer Chris Barlow followed by "Matisse in Soho" with Michael Reagan, Curator of a forthcoming major exhibition “Matisse in Britain” [2028].
Harmony in Diversity. Get the afternoon energy moving with a display of some invigorating male belly dancing.
Fealy Films Mini Independent Film Festival.

After All (事过方觉)  Directed by Chongyan Liu
A therapist at a Berlin university navigates delicate emotional terrain as she provides solace to a grieving student grappling with the suicide of a trans woman on campus.

5:45 - 6:15pm.  “Queens of Clubs”.
The multi-talented  Celine Hispiche brings proceedings to a finale, with a show celebrating the women prominent in   founding clubs in Soho, from Kate Meyrick to Muriel Belcher..  (Ticket booking essential).

travel_info: Tube: Leicester Square, Oxford Circus, Tottenham Court Road

name: De Lane Lea Studios, 75 Dean Street
